review_text: So fun! I highly recommend Fright Nights for Halloween, they add haunted houses and actors to bring the Halloween experience alive! There are rice and haunted house wait times but it s worth the wait. The park is especially beautiful at night when everything is lit up. There is fun theme park food options and rides for a range of ages and comfort levels. It s easy to get to by transit and there is lots of parking across the street. Would definitely recommend if you are looking for thrills and fun!

I visited to Playland Amusement Park in winters during Fright Night. It was a thrilling experience. The Halloween theme added an exciting twist to the park. Everywhere you turned, you were immersed in a ghostly atmosphere with lots of haunted houses, making it perfect for the spooky season. Its a unique and fun way to celebrate Halloween with family and friends, providing a memorable and spine-tingling adventure. It was very crowded at this Fright night event, especially during the second week of Halloween-themed festivities. With the popularity of the event, its important to plan ahead, arrive early, and be prepared for larger crowds.

We visited Playland on August the 10th, we had to stand for almost 30-45 minute in the line till they open the gate at 1pm. There was a deal buy one get one. Also We had to wait longer then expected to try certain games reached more than 30 minutes which made our chances less to enjoy all the games. But it was fun to be there and my kids enjoyed.

Lots of fun rides for all ages! This place will make you feel young at heart. I visited during the PNE Fair and I enjoyed all the attractions. The Farm section and train ride are great additions for kids. Went on a weekday and there was less crowd, average of 20 minutes wait time to get on the most popular rides, making it very enjoyable.

Dont miss the PNE Fair - Great place to visit with family, Lots of activities and fun for kids and adults. Must watch the dog show its very entertaining. Pig race was funny. Food is awesome but a bit on the pricey side.

The PNE (Pacific National Exhibition) is undeniably a wonderful place for family outings, but our recent visit left us with a mixed bag of experiences. While the overall enjoyment was high, there were a few hiccups along the way. One aspect that could be improved is the pricing. The entry fees and the requirement for thrill passes can add up, making it a bit pricey for families. Additionally, some of the rides, including the wooden roller coaster and the hellevator, were out of service during our visit. This resulted in longer lines for the kid-friendly rides, which was a bit frustrating. On a brighter note, the farm exhibition was a big hit with the kids. The variety of animals, from cows to water buffalo, offered a fantastic learning experience. The magic show, pig races, and the real knight fight with horses were thrilling and entertaining. Plus, the free ice cream was a delightful treat. The PNE does offer a silver lining in that you can enjoy the shows and exhibitions with just a general admission ticket, which is a money-saving option. Despite a few setbacks, our day at the PNE was filled with memorable family moments and a wide range of entertainment options, making it a worthwhile destination for families looking for a fun day out.
Nice place to hang out with kids. There are variety of rides (for different ages) and great options for food. In some attractions the queues are very long. The place is clean.

It was a great trip. I went there with my friends and we all bought the thrill passes. It was worth it. The thrill games (especially the Beasts) was fun and exciting. The queue for each game was long on the weekend so you might want to be there early when the park open. We started at 12pm and was able to finish all the thrill games at 5pm. The food is not that great but you can go out for lunch and come back. If you go in the summer, rmb to bring umbrella and water.

I loved this place. I felt like I was in a movie. You can really have fun, play and earn prizes like stuffed animals, and they have amusement rides for kids and also for adults so this is great for the whole family.
Amazing X 2000. If you like exciting games, you must go! Highly recommend the coaster ride even waited around 2hrs!
So much fun! Been attending since 1970s! The GF Tornado Potato was amazing and worth the wait. I drank good coffee and sipped adult slushies! The 6pm Drag Show was so lovely! Great day.
Its been years since I have been. It was well worth it, some great food and great things to see. Especially the Monet exhibit. Made the whole event worth it Visited on Weekend Wait time
Loved the rides. They can do with a bit more variety of food vendors though. The rides were quite safe. Even the 65 year old roller coaster.

PNE is super big and always busy. I highly recommend to buy your tickets   online so no need to wait in line for tickets  . All the big rides are amazing  . It was fun watching pig   race in the PNE farm.

This is the best place in the city to spend a summer day, especially with kids. Good variety of rides. Enough options for food.  There are huge queues at some of the attractions. But overall its an awesome experience.
Annual visit to playland and PNE. Always fun. Good greasy food. Lots of recycling/composting stations. No cash. Credit cards or gift cards only.
Fun attractions for kids of all ages. Rides are pretty fun lots of games and food and drinks.

Our favourite outing on our stay in Vancouver! I don t have anything negative to say just an overall great experience! I would just like to make a simple reminder that I happened to overlook when on the website and in line for rides. Wear close toed shoes or take a pair to switch out for certain rides if need be. I was turned away for wearing slides after waiting in a healthy lineup for The Beast, Hells Gate, Breakdance and two others. Ps. Crocs are acceptable!
Fun place yo visit during month of October for Halloween. Lots of great rides and haunted hunts.

Love supporting the PNE and Playland and all of their building venues. But nowadays it is so unaffordable for Low Income families and people on a fixed income. They should have family days where families and those on a fixed income can enjoy what the PNE and Playland as well as other events can offer.

long lines, bring a small fan especially in this weather. come in early if you want to take all the rides. at least 1 hour wait time per ride. rides were super fun tho. first ride to take is the beast and then the hellevator. then you can take whatever you want.
Came here for fright night and it was a blast. Huge lines for a lot of the stuff but they went pretty quickly. Tickets aren t too bad either and get you unlimited rides.
A wide variety of things to see and do here, lots of good food to eat on site and nearby. Worthwhile experience for any family! Visited on

Gotta visit this place once a year for an all-around family fun time. Never gets old but the only problem is the parking which if you are lucky can be found around the many homes that offer a spot for $20 flat fee. Plenty of seating areas all around the fair. BCAA members get a 30% hahaha
PNE is small Amusement park compair to Six Flags, but its one and only Amusement park in Vancouver. I love to go PNE Fair every summer. Visited on
Fun park for kids . Was visiting Vancouver for few days . Kids had a lot of fun on rides and the price of entry tickets includes the rides + you can pay more for big rides . All inclusive price.

PNE and Playland combined together is a nice place to be. After your fill of great rides you can slow down a bit and play some games. The shows are hit and miss but you will always get something out of it. Great place to take your kids. But so keep in mind this is like any other fair: their prices are jacked up. Small price to pay for happiness I guess *shrug*.
I went on a last minute whim to meet up with family. It was a very great way to visit and have some fun.

Havent visited in years, decided to bring the 6 yr old. Bought tickets in advance, however you can purchase ticket at the gate. No line up for entry or buying tickets. Was an awesome time, lineups for rides werent that long. Site was only open from 11am to 5pm - we arrived around 1. Should have gone earlier as wasnt able to get to do everything, given had to eat and rest and all that. Speaking of food, highly recommend bringing extra snacks as everything is ridiculously expensive: $7 for cotton candy, $21 for 5 chicken strips/fries/juice (see photo - those are large fries), etc etc. There were water refill stations, so bringing a water bottle helps keep you hydrated. Or to pour over your head. Premises was kept very clean and there were cooling fans blowing cold mist. 2 parking lots within walking distance available for $15.

Had a awesome day here. Open till 5 then they close for a hour to sanitize. Friendly staff. Awesome rides. Buy the thrill pass it s worth the price of 45$ish. The roller coaster is closed and so is the drop of doom and a couple others but still lots of rides.

We had fun. Not in agreement with the half day admission though. Line ups are easily 45 minutes each ride and you only get to be there for 6 hours which means you essentially only get access to 6 rides. I liked it better when you were able to go for the whole day and got to take your time and could chose if you wanted to go at 12:30pm and leave at 7pm. Or whenever. The day was yours. The rides were awesome

End of summer tradition. Superdogs are always the best!!! Although mostly the same every year, it s an awesome place for family to have fun! The rides are not too crowded thanks to the new limitation to ticketing. We had a great fun, enjoyable and memorable day!

Obviously it costs some money   but well worth the fun we had! I wish I knew that my 3 year old could ride for free with my ride pass   I spent $40 something on his ride pass when I didnt need to ... That sucked.. but oh well. We went in blazing heat, 33deg that day... Luckily had hats and re fillable bottles for water, which we used to douse our heads and backs repeatedly. I eat a strict ketogenic diet, so I brought all my own food in. They didnt even check my small cooler. We LOVED the legends of Drag show!!!!      So wonderful I took my two kids, ages 3 and 10 and my sister too. Great times had by all!

SO! MUCH! FUN! even without a ride pass. (   drop a like) I went on the last day of the fair and ride passes and coupons were sold out, which was quite confusing, never seen it happen before. We were given a map when we got in to check out the events. Its important to stick to the schedule so you make the most of the place. Unfortunately, my group made it on time at 7pm to the horse show, only to have it never happen. Expect to spend many many dollars at the fair. Every single business will ask for a tip on top of marked up prices, and the fun archery activity will cost you. Every interactice activity will cost you
This place is amazing for all ages but be sure to bring money it can be expensive when buying food, merch or anything but it is a great time
Always fun at Playland . No Rollie coaster though . I really wish they would turn Playland into a six Flags like park

I went for fright nights and it was a great experience. Definitely recommend getting early access or the fast pass you can, as the haunted house lines later in the night get very, very long. Fun rides and good scares!
I ve got so much fun being there! I d recommend to buy tickets in advance since you can save some $$$. Great place to spend time with family and friends. Visited on

Great time at the PNE every time, with the park opened up for animal exhibits, live acts, concert series, movies in the park, food vendors of all kinds, rides for all ages makes this the end of summer destination. Recommend the Rapid Pass ride option to save countless hours of waiting on line for the ride of your choice, with some lines being 1-3 hour wait makes the rapid pass the best way to go with limited amount of passes available per day. Ride pass is separate from gate pass so be sure to purchase both tickets with rapid pass upgrade available at the ride ticket purple roof booths, haunted house or the odd ride attraction are not covered under ride passes or PNE gift cards with a separate individual charge per person. Have fun and enjoy everything that PNE has to offer! Make sure you bring water bottles for the refill stations, lockers available for your needs, debit or credit only as not much cash is acceptable throughout the park. Thank you

Finally PNE fair is back. It s amazing. Excellent shows, you must see sup dogs show and Westcoast lumberjack show in addition to different other bands. Barn was great with different animals, your kids will enjoy ride on some. Excellent different varieties of food trucks that satisfy different needs. Market place is a nice place to visit there. Parking is easy and costs $20 . PNE fair this 2021 is from August 21 to September 6.

PNE is a super place for family day outing. They have food, rides, and activities which keep engaged every age group. During the Fair, they have dog shows, dance shows, music shows and on the top of it an amazing fire and light show in the late evening. They also have lots of good food options. The opening time is 11:00 AM. They have tickets in 3 categories,  Thrill pass  which include all rides and cost you $39,  Family Fun pass  which has fewer rides less and cost you $29 and then individual tickets for rides.
Crazy rides,,, went with my friends today ,, it was soooo much funnn,,, Especially Roles coaster and the Beast

Short lines, even on a Saturday! The rides are fun, with lots of variety. We had a great day here! Admittedly, the food isnt great. The longest line was to get inside. It was all the way around the block! But it moved very quickly, and once inside, the crowd spread out. Visited on
Such a fun family event!! We got to go on a few rides. Long line ups but worth the wait! Good food and cute farm animals. My boys favorite part was meeting the super dogs!!!
Good overall. Avoid school days. Long lines and limited time so you will have tough time to get all rides with you kids.
Really nice. Small compact place but its ok
A very nice place to visit with family !! A lot to do and a lot of nice ice-cream and foods

Dont spend too much on a wristband if your only going for a few hours, there isnt that many rides that dont have extremely long lines. The petting zoo is excellent and the free shows are abundant. Paying admission and a few tickets will be good for an afternoon
Always a lot of fun, excellent staff,and  clean facilities. Thoroughly enjoy ourselves.

Great day at Playland and the PNE! Great place to visit with family and friends! Also a great place to spend your money lol... especially if you bring your kids. But this is a good way to spend a whole day out having fun! Snacks, entertainment, rides, shows, the PNE and Playland really has everything.

The last time I went to the PNE we had a great day  The whole family came and it was fun. Whether it s going on the pirate ship or watching the demolition derby it is always a fun filled day with many memories being made  I can t wait till they open back up fully so I can go back with my friends and family and enjoy the thrill and rides..
Fright night was amazing.  It was fun

Super duper fun times! Fair priced and plenty to offer. Do yourself a favor and just get the thrill pass, it is worth it even if you just go on a couple of the bigger rides. Me and my 10 yr old had a blast, despite the rain. Cant wait to play again next year!
Fun and thrill place to be. Some rides the wait time is long. They should fill up the seat vs accommodating ppl who wants to b with a group.. Anyhow. Its fun and great. We have fun

We had a great time at the PNE since it is less crowded and the weather was sunny but not too hot. Fair is smaller too compared to years ago eg lumberjack show is quite smaller from what I remembered it back decades ago. But still plenty of food, entertainment, rides and games for everyone.
Winter Fair in PNE was absolutely amazing. Music, decoration, food, skating , holidays spirit, even whether was excellent. Worse to visit next year.

Nelly concert was amazing! It s a new dynamic with the open alcohol. Didn t see any issues thankfully. There were definitely a few pretty buzzed adults. Tried the colossal onion, it was good but too big and to expensive. Also had an apple pie beaver tail which was very tasty.

This place is well worth all your time and money you spend here. Amazing rides and games for kids and grown ups. Food options are limited but quite enough. You can even get your own packed stuff. It s so much fun you won t want to come back.

We bought the 11am to 5pm tickets online, which avoids us to line up. So we went straight to the main entrance and got the tickets scanned. Once our tickets were checked, we received like a wrist paper band. The amusement park is huge with many people waiting for their turn to have a ride. Food (hamburger, soda, lemonades...) are sold over there as well. We bought the thrill experience tickets (requires to be at least 48tall). By 5pm, you have to leave the compound.
What  can I say....ITS PLAYLAND!!!! AND AMAZING...ly expensive... but my 3 daughters,  wife and I go every year atleast once... but cant wait for PNE to open

The PNE was spectacular. We arrived at 2pm next thing we were leaving at closing 11pm. We went on many rides like, atmosphere, swings, hellavator, the beast, pirate ship, unfortunately the ol wooden Rollercoaster was closed for renovation. The rides were all shuffled in together not spread out like past years, but I liked it didnt have to walk around so far to repeat rides. Plus there was limited capacity which was fine, no long line ups. There was live music shows all day. We seen Super Dogs, my fav. The pyrotechnics & firework show was Amazing!! At one point the fireworks blasted strait into the audience. Of course, it had a designated safety point to land at but it sure felt like we were goin to get blasted. Id def. see that again, and for free. Spectacular!!The food vendors had a good variety of food, like BBQ, tacos, hotdogs, burgers, fries, oh and dont forget, the best viewing homemade in ur face, just before leaving fresh warm mini donuts. There was anime store selling mystery bags, kids thought it was awesome. Booking online for admission and ride wrist bands made it alot easier, didnt have long lineups. If I go on Ill be writing a book. It was a great time and were going back for Playland in a couple weeks. Thanks PNE!!

I m a real theme park guy, been all over the states to some pretty good ones, and I think playland is still my favourite one and it has a lot to offer. For one, the PNE is right there with lots of food and entertainment options, but that s besides the point. Within playland proper you have all the carnival games you could desire, some decent food options, mini golf, and honestly a pretty dope selection of rides. The wooden rollercoaster is still my favourite coaster of all time, rivalled only by the cyclone at cony island (similar vibe). It s a very old coaster that feels as though it can break down at any moment- this only adds to the experience. Other great options include the hellavator and the beast, but that s not all, try going on fright nights for the haunted houses, you WILL definitely wet your pants.
PNE fair 2022 Aug24-September 5 Adult ticket $18/per Was fun! Food trucks,shows,electric fire,animals and exhibition We are there for 4 hours!

First time back since Cvd.  Not super packed which was nice. Water stations are a great idea for the hot days.  Cashless contact also noted. Love this place.  Raised the kids coming here all the time and now the grandbabies!

Well its the PNE! What isnt great?! Lots of great food, vendors and rides! Prize home and events are always great. I hate the lines so we went at about 3 and did food and vendors, then rides in the evening when theres 3 hours left and you can bounce ride to ride with little lines. Always a blast! Glad I went thiss year :) OH if you have BCAA buy your tickets online! I did and saved 30%! Way better.
response_from_owner_text: Thanks for the feedback, Laura! We hope to see you again soon.

review_text: I went with my kids the first day it opened .It is very expensive to play any of the games . But if you buy an adult ride pass you can ride all the rides as many times as you can . All the big rides do have at least a 5 ride wait , but some of them are sooooo worth it . There is quite an assortment of food , I recommend the deep fried onions if you like onion rings these are so much better . And have a great time  we did . Ps it is a long day but if you are  with the right people you WILL have a GREAT time . Check out the last show as well its the pyro show and lots of fun to watch .
Great family friendly outing. The park is kept clean and there are rides for all levels of thrill seekers. You also wont go hungry - loads of great restaurants and stalls. Highly recommended!
Kids had a blast! There is something for almost every age. Lots of the classic rides are still there -- wooden rollercoaster, flume, bumper cars. But I do miss the music box... Visited on
Fun!! There are pretty many options for the rides

Went to see UB40 40th anniversary tour and they did not disappoint. PNE is fantastic. It was busy but you felt relax because you can still walk around without getting stuck in people traffic. The food stand and other exhibition were same as before besides the transportation area. All in all brilliant place. Will be going again soon.

It is a great and memorable experience for tourists and newcomers. The attractions, The food and the games are enjoyable, but pricing for food items and additional rides are quite expensive, so be prepared to spend a lot. Overall a great experience

Always a good day trip to watch the shows, look around the market place and if you feel adventurous you can go to Playland and get on various rides. Also an excellent assortment of county fair type foods.

My favourite place ever. I was sad when they traded the Big Swings, but I was so grateful that Play Land was able to stay open during the pandemic. I absolutely looooooove that they now have  nights  at Playland and  adult  nights. This place gets better and better every year! Thank you for my favourite pandemic mask. I rocked it all year long!

What a great place. So glad it is back open. Go have fun, but when you go, you cant worry about money, so bring a lot. Go when there are also horse races. Make sure you get tickets to a good concert too.

Scaled down version for 2021 but still lots of fun, the lumberjack show and the superdogs are must see attractions, still many overpriced food with small portions to be aware of but if you know that already half the battle has been won.
Great fun. Got to see Chicago perform live as part of the Summer Night Concert events they have going on in 2022.

I have taken my children here a lot and came here as a child with siblings ..A great place to have loads of fun and be on rides and see the sights and sounds and food trucks that are so good..Come on out and also see the halloweens fright nights too!

Avoid going on a weekend. Would highly recommend not buying the all rides pass as the line ups are crazy. All rides pass does not include all rides. Good food options. Live music and shows. Overall a great experience.

Amazing place. Have something for every age. Everyone can enjoy. Food is much expensive and not great quality but the vibe is so good. It gets busy in. the weekend so its better to reach half an hour early to the opening

The shows are wonderful and Im glad to see so many vendors participate this year.  Lovely atmosphere and great vibe here, though Im not sure if this is what reduced capacity should look like with all the crowds here.

Was a fun afternoon for the family. We took our toddler and she had many experiences from riding ponies to eating mini donuts to riding the kid Rollercoaster with mom! The beer was a little overpriced at $9.50 a can, but the experience was good for our baby!

PNE Fair usually happens mid-to-late August, and ends in early September, usually on Labour Day. For the past few years, they are closed on Mondays due to lack of attendance in past fairs. There are many ways in saving for admission. They do offer free admission days (X2 days), library day (show a valid library card), VanCity members (show your VanCity Credit Union card) and so on. Just check PNE.ca for deals. Parking is $20 unless you want to pay the little old ladies hawking parking spots on their properties. Transit is also good too. Free parking is available, just have to look for them about several blocks away (just make sure you pay attention to the street signs, or else pay $150 parking fine!) Games? Different games offer different prizes. Maybe I didnt notice in previous years, but the smaller kid games is guaranteed a prize. More or less, you are paying for the stuff animal. So, $5 gets a small prize to $20 get you a jumbo one. I think this is such a smart move on the PNE Fair, cuz its a money grabber but also, encourage kids to play!? My game that I play is whack-a-mole. Scored 2 jumbo stuffed animals for $10, but you need at least 9-11 players. Food? Beer? Drinks? Always expensive. The mini donuts have gone up in price this year. It 1 bag $5, 2 for $10 or 3 for $13. In 2018, it was 3 bags for $10! I guess oil has gone up! But, overall, its the experience. Marketplace? What amazes me is people go nuts for the steam mops, air coolers, chair massagers. Toon City? A different children experience. My kids highlight of the day. The dancers were awesome especially this one lone guy. Then another show on the Super Academy. Very eventful. Barn yard: same thing every year, barn animals, discovery kids tour to horse riding, blacksmith show and so on. So thankful for the sinks to wash those hands!? Rides? I cant say much on this, as my kids a bit young for them. Sure, they got children rides, but its super pack. I would rather come during Playland when its quieter and shorter lines!? Arcade? Its gone. Boarded up and the main entrance is block by the how strong you can hit game. Dog show? The stroller parking is crazy. Great to park it, crazy after the show. The staging area is now 3/4 the ice rink. Which means less seats. White Spot is in the Coliseum, so you can eat in an air condition seating area! Concerts? Two concerts. The paid one vs the free ones. The paid ones reserved seats  vs general admission)  happens at 830pm, namely a past headliner. This years headliner were Billy Idol, Smokey Robinson, Vanilla Ice, MC Hammer, TLC (although, Lisa Lopez passed away, so its only TC), etc. The free ones are basically bands playing radio hits. Not bad actually. Either case, you can find a spot and guarantee you can enjoy the music still. One thing I did notice for 2019 is the PNE has upgraded its fairgrounds. How? New blacktop among some of the rides, newer looking amusement games. PNE is amazing at night with the games and rides shining through. Before I go, and I always wanted to work at the PNE so I can say, win a house, win a car, get your tickets here!

Visited during Slayland (Covid fright nights replacement) and Im really happy to say the virus wasnt the scariest thing there! They did a great job enforcing masks, social distancing, and crowds. I felt safe and comfortable. We rode every ride, and a handful of them repeatedly without lines. Great work adapting! I just wish it wasnt $40 a head including for children.

I was worried at first as someone with a disability (and mobility aids) but when I say this park is accessible I mean it. Absolutely amazing staff that were super kind and patient! Any disabled people who are worried, I can say without a doubt this amusement park is 100% accessible!!!
Great fun, too expensive, but hey, once a year, gotta go. I go for the concerts, Billy Idol was awesome, and Blue Rodeo gonna be great, seen them last year, and they havent missed a beat.
Always fun despite the line ups! I took my seven year old son there and we had a blast! Get ready to spend some money though!

Great place to spend the day during the summer. The water rides are a lot of fun. Fright night is a must for halloween. There are several haunted houses and actors walking around. The food gets expensive, so I recommend walking to the McDonalds which is down the street. I wish there were a few more rides, but unfortunately theres not enough space for any more.

Worth the experience. Make sure if you re going to go, go just as they open, which is around early June. You ll get barely any lines which results in less that 5 minutes of waiting per ride and no need to spend extra money on priority ticket-type stuff.
Despite the rain we had a good time with the indoor exhibits! Too rainy to go on rides but hopefully next time.

Considering all things covid playland was awesome to visit. The rides were at lower capacity but the lines moved fast. My only complaint is theres no midway food...youre limited to two locations to buy (whitespot and pizza pizza) which makes people spend an hr waiting in line. Also everything is pay via debit and credit. No cash.
How can one not enjoy Playland?!  Us grownups went to a concert, ate carnival food, drank a few beer and went through the haunted house on a full moon. Lotsa fun!
Rides, Food Truck Vendors and Exibits filled with things to see and purchase.

Biggest and best wooden roller coaster in the world.  Sad to see the corkscrew go, but with Playland expanding I am excited to see what comes next.  Always order the mini donuts,  but dont eat to much before going on rides like Enterprise or Breakdance.  The Beast is utterly terrifying.   Bathrooms are really heavily trafficked but frequently cleaned.  Parking is expensive, and there is not much free parking in the nearby neighborhoods.  I come to PNE Playland at least three times a year.

The PNE is as awesome as it ever was. My son had a lot of fun on the rides and the attractions. Super Dogs is always amazing! There are a lot of young farm workers who know their stuff and really taught my 6yo a lot about cows, horses and chickens today! And the food...omg the food!!! There are also Dino s this year, which were a huge hit!

Expensive-ish. Long-ish lines. Isnt that pretty normal and expected, though? Lots to do! If youre an adult who likes to make themselves feel sick, you can get in, do a couple of your favourite rides, and drink beers and stuff. Obviously kids have fun. Its a land of fun, deemed fun land.

Thanks to Sheldon Arsenault, Manager, Group Sales & Call Centre, my partner and I had the best time at the PNE on opening day August 19, 2023. We had received a PNE gift certificate from my partner s stepmom in 2021 and we hadn t been able to use it. Sheldon had to figure out how to activate this ancient voucher and was able to transfer it to a PNE gift card, which was easy to use around the fair. It was fantastic and so well organized! The food was incredible and we definitely ate too much. Thank you Sheldon!

Excellent fair this year! Went on August 26th (a Saturday) and had a blast. Tickets were highly available even late in the day, and the crowds werent as bad as I was anticipating for a weekend. Great selection of thrill rides!

The wait for the wooden roller coaster was legitimately an hour. Waits for everything else were very minimal. Hopefully they get a second set of cars running for the rollercoaster soon to speed up the wait.
Great place to experience modern thrill rides, as well as some classics such as Wild Mouse and of course the amazing wooden coaster.  Fun classic games as well!
Fun. Entertaining. Lines werent too long unless you are waiting for food. Parking at the lot is 25.50 total for the whole day. So stay for the whole day. Worth it
